postContent:
Waha Wera owes it unique taste to both its unorthodox combination of ingredients and unusual production process. It blends kiwi fruit, manuka honey and habanero peppers and uses barrel fermentation for an interesting effect.

A set of bold and fun flyers were produced to help promote the sauce at marketing events in preparation for it's UK launch.
postExcerpt: Waha Wera is a very unique hot sauce from New Zealand. In preparation for it’s UK launch we were commissioned by the distributor to design a set of flyers used to promote a inform potential buyers

postContent:
Due to the volume and diversity of the body of work produced at Amalgam, the home page is a full screen slide show containing a variety of projects covering all disciplines. This allows partners to highlight some of their favourite projects.

postContent:
Surround Speakers Boutique is an online retailer of high end speakers and audio equipment. Products found on the website are carefully selected for their design and performance.

The objective was to design an identity which reflects the precision and craftsmanship that goes into creating products of such high standard. In addition to forming the first two initials of the store name the shape of the letter s was also chosen because it can represent how sound travels through space.
postExcerpt: Create an identiy which reflects the quality of the curated products. All the products found on the webiste are designed and engineered with utmost precision and care. felis dapibus

postContent:
Formed by three East 15 Acting School graduates sharing a common vision, Highrise Theatre is a theatre company aiming to engage a young audience(‘the Xbox generation’) and raise awareness about the UK’s cultural, social and political issues through theatre. By using authentic stories, anecdotes and activism Highrise is inviting a new audience into theatres, provoking thought and facilitating a debate around the highlighted issues.

To reflect the purpose of the organisation a strong, urban and rebellious design solution was required.

Given that council estates are a stage for a lot of the issues Highrise Theatre wants to focus on we formed the identity’s colour scheme from colours found in hallways of a derelict London council block. Coupled with the thick line featured in the logo a strong visual language for the identity emerged.
postExcerpt: As theatre is traditionally perceived as a past time of the more affluent an identity which differentiates Highrise from the established theatre companies was needed.

postContent:
It’s quirky, warm and dimly lit interior make way for what a very intimate and romantic dining experience. The restaurants magic effect is further amplified by the remote and rough industrial surroundings.

In keeping with the restaurant’s ethos the home page animates a number of quirky statements about the restaurant in order to incite curiosity and encourage exploration of the site. The nav and the calls to action are clearly visible at all times.

To reinforce the restaurants romantic and intimate mood large background images are used throughout the site and different parts of the image are revealed as the user scrolls.

On the gallery screens the interface is minimal and the nav goes into a minimised state letting the photography occupy majority of the screen unobstructed.
postExcerpt: Mosaica is all about good food and atmosphere. Located on the bottom floor of a factory building the restaurant feels like a magical escape from reality. The new website needed to reflect the atmosphere and charm as it’s in an unexpected location.
